channel.title: Looking for a Java teacher
channel.description: I'm very interested in getting to know the Java language. I'm not paying but i am not asking for your assistance 24/7 i just would like to learn the basics so some day i can create my own Source or maybe a new revison! i learn and catch on quickly, I am mature and respectful im not 100% retarded when it comes to servers im not like how do i change the ip backgrounds i know how to get a server online and host it. Well to be honest i used to leech servers a few years a go and hosted them without giving them credit but i am past that stage and am ready to move on to making my own server. We can talk on Skype or Msn or anything tbh doesn't matter to me. Anyways that about sums it up Private message me or add me on here for my Skype or Msn

item.title: Looking for a Java teacher
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:7, topic:460210”]I’d 110% recommend the Really Big Index by Oracle, that’s what I used when I was going to bother learning Java.

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/reallybigindex.html[/quote]

As Ruby has stated the docs will be your best bet here.

Why go to these copy cats when you can have the original.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a Java teacher
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Chingchong123, post:4, topic:460210”][quote author=Whackatre link=topic=563129.msg4104893#msg4104893 date=1347853594]
chances are, if you give up rsps you will have a higher chance of success.
[/quote]
I dont doubt that i will have a higher chance of success, But being 13 what do i have to succeed at school? no need already several lessons ahead in every class. This is just something to do when i’m bored[/quote]
I don’t think you fully comprehend my intended message. What I meant was that you should attempt something unrelated to rsps.

Seriously, go on Java IRC channels such as #java in both quakenet and freenode if you need assistance. They provide excellent help. Stackoverflow is also a great archive of programming-related questions.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a Java teacher
item.dc:creator: @Chingchong123 Chingchong123
item.description:
@Chingchong123 wrote:

chances are, if you give up rsps you will have a higher chance of success.

I dont doubt that i will have a higher chance of success, But being 13 what do i have to succeed at school? no need already several lessons ahead in every class. This is just something to do when i’m bored

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a Java teacher
item.dc:creator: @Chingchong123 Chingchong123
item.description:
@Chingchong123 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:2, topic:460210”]http://www.dummies.com/how-to/computers-software/programming/java.html

I’ve seen series of java programming tutorials on youtube, you could check those out too.[/quote]
Thanks will definetly look into those.

Read full topic
